website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to easily and painlessly relieving babies of clogged noses, it’s hard to beat how well this aspirator gets the job done.
pros: Parts stay together well, and easily come apart for cleaning
Made from soft silicone for more comfort during use
Comes with a convenient case and cap to cover the device and keep it clean
Efficiently relieves stuffy noses and clears boogers without pain
cons: Meant mostly for newborns and infants as the tube is very small

customer_reviews.title: Better for Newborn Infants than older babies!
customer_reviews.text: This is mainly for premature babies and newborn infants! The suction tube that enters the nostrils is really tiny and sinks into the nose of my 18 month year old girl. As a result the suction is not nearly as strong as the Nose Frida which has a wider nose tube. We have been using the Nose Frida since our baby was a newborn and now in retrospect I wish I started with this instead and transitioned to the Nose Frida now (after 12 months). This isn't a bad gadget but it should be advertised as something for newborns to 12 month old babies.
customer_reviews.author: Olaf Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My 2 month old HATED that one
customer_reviews.text: It's much easier to decongest my baby's nose with this than the one they gave us in the hospital. My 2 month old HATED that one, it always made her cry and squirm. The tip to this one seems much softer and she hasn't cried once or rejected it like she did with the one from the hospital. And it works! Her boogs went right into the little container thing (not in my mouth!!! No worries there haha). It was still a pain to suck them out, which is why I give it 4 stars instead of 5. But I feel infinately better using this for my baby than the other one and am very happy with it! Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: So far ok but minor concerns
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this product 5 stars but I did what the tip told me to do and use a tissue as a guard for a runny nose. First time I did it, I could barely get air through then I tried again and it didn't work. My baby's mucus went up the tubing and almost into my mouth. I wish they would give you better directions than a sticker on the box. It does work getting the snot out but not without some issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mel G

customer_reviews.title: A must buy to keep baby comfortable with an unstuffed nose!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was really skeptical about trying this for our new baby, but I know how our previous babies hated the regular big green booger suckers from the hospital. To say the least this item was the best thing EVER. The tip of it is so small and soft and gently fits into the babies nose and you can suck as hard or soft as you like. Obviously no baby is going to like this at all but this item has definitely been life changing for our newborn. It also comes apart very easily and is very easy to clean and put right back together!! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Dever

customer_reviews.title: Better for smaller nostrils
customer_reviews.text: This works, and it works well... but be warned, it can (and will) back up into the tube. Its much better for smaller nostrils than the alternative. Next time I'll try to figure out how to put tissue in it as a filter, but it always backs into the tube. If you've ever used an open system breast pump, if you tilt it a certain way the milk will go back in the tube.... same idea. We both have the same cold right now, so I can get past it for now. Cleaning wasn't bad. Soak in soapy water. It doesn't hold as much as the snot sucker, but if your baby has tiny nostrils you'll get a better seal.
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so, so glad that I bought this when I did! I just happened to buy it right before my 11 month old got her first cold. Those bulb aspirators that you get from the hospital do nothing to help. My baby has been so congested. She doesn't particularly care for her nose being cleaned out but at least this product works fast and is efficient! I followed the advice from some of the other reviews and have been putting a small piece of tissue in the bottom. I use this several times a day and have never gotten anything in my mouth. Super easy to clean and assemble. I'd definitely recommend this product to other parents!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the reviews, bubzi offers discounts in exchange for five star reviews
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the five star reviews, they are bought by the company. The plastic carrying case comes with two labels. One gives a tip explaining that a tissue should be placed in the aspirator in lieu of a filter. Te other, much larger label says this: Thank you for purchasing our baby nasal aspirator! If you love this product we would greatly appreciate a 5 star review on amazon. In return we would like to offer you a 50% coupon discount. Coupon code: BUBZI153 I bought this item based on the hundreds of five star reviews, not knowing the company is buying those reviews with a discount code.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: It's a God Send!! Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have! I was using the blue bulb like I always have with my other children. The baby would scream bloody murder and I didnt get much out from suctioning. I ordered the Bubzi after researching, and I'm glad I did! At first I was scared because I didnt understand how the parts would work with me sucking on the tube to suction out my child's nose. I didnt want none of the mucus in my mouth. It actually works better then expected and my child most times doesnt even Cry when I'm using it. I love this product! Everybody with a baby need this!
customer_reviews.author: Von G.

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I use this when my babies are sick. It’s simple to use, you need a little nipple brush to clean out the hose. I never sucked snot into my mouth but be careful, it doesn’t prevent you from getting the sick germs like the hospital bulb would (you’re sucking up the germs). Lesson learned. I like how you can see if it’s clean though, something you can’t be sure about with the bulb. Also, you can’t use this if you want to clear phlegm from the baby’s mouth. I keep both around.
customer_reviews.author: JTS

customer_reviews.title: I thought i liked it, but always wondered if there was something ...
customer_reviews.text: We previously used another, wildly popular brand of nasal aspirator with the hard, blue plastic. I thought i liked it, but always wondered if there was something better. This is! The pieces stay together without having to hold them together while wrestling an uncooperative, death-rolling toddler. The part that actually goes to their nostril is much softer and more comfortable for them, too. My toddler actually stopped struggling when I used this one!
customer_reviews.author: C. Kemp

customer_reviews.title: this is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought an electric one (different brand) inside a walgreens. When i used it on baby i was a bit disappointed. It worked but not well enough. I had ordered this one before little one was born and had forgot about it. When she got sick I found it going through some drawers. Used it on baby and it was awesome. The little tip that goes in her nose is super soft so it doesnt hurt her. And you are in control of the amount of suction that can happen. So i would def recommend this. I think its essential for any mom with babies to have.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: This one or nosefrida. Both great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owed and loved Nosedrida for quite a long time. It works beautifully. My husband bought me this one and I must say it’s also a great product. What I like about this is that the tip is made of silicone (so it won’t hurt the baby’s nose trill when he moves) and that it doesn’t require filters. I do feel like I’m going to eat a snot at some point when I’m using it, though. Hahaha... That feeling I don’t get with Nosefrida. I have yet to test it for heavy secretions but for snots, it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: V. Natale

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waist your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. That about sums it up. Purchased an electric aspirator (will update with specific one bc they are not all good) that literally hands down is the best thing I have ever purchased for my kids. If you need one of the easily manual mobile for on the go, just get the nose Freda. I have tried 4-5 different manual on the go aspirators and the Freda, although def has its limitations, it’s the best. Sorry bubzi
customer_reviews.author: Ghia B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning noses
customer_reviews.text: I breed cats which means I have a number of them. Some time cats get URI which is serious. Of a cat can't smell, the a cat won't eat. If a cat doesn't eat, it's body goes downhill quickly. Not eating can cause death in just a couple of days. I bought this to help clear cat noses. I just have one who was very congested and this worked like a charm pulling the snot from her poor little nose.
customer_reviews.author: aundrealea

customer_reviews.title: Best aspirator
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the bulb and even better than the most popular nose sucker out there. This aspirator’s tube is silicone so it flexes with your movements. The nose freida I’ve had was stiff and fell apart every time I had to use it. Wriggly toddlers make it very frustrating. I haven’t had issues with sucking the mucous into my mouth but I am always using it when the child is vertical. It is easy to take apart to clean. I air dry it then put it in the case it comes with. I wish I would have had this a year ago!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Dillingham

customer_reviews.title: My 3 month old has had really bad allergies and he's been pretty miserable
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver! My 3 month old has had really bad allergies and he's been pretty miserable. Bulb syringes don't do nearly as good of a job, since there's not as much control over suction, you can't clean inside them, and you can't figure out the best angle, etc. This aspirator comes apart easily for cleaning and is sturdy. I love the storage case. Also, I have no idea how people are accidentally sucking up snot, the way the aspirator is constructed prevents this. I'm so glad I got this one, I'll definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kaytie

customer_reviews.title: I just had my 5th child and would recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I just had my 5th child and would recommend this product. Ive used a lot of different products ranging from the ball syringe to battery operated booger suckers. And this in my opinion works the best and no fuss. I just wish the case had been a tad more durable. My 2yr old proved its structural integrity with in 2 seconds after i opened it and was trying it on the baby. Other than that product is awesome and i will be purchasing again for friends future babyshowers.
customer_reviews.author: Willow Riverside

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I came upon this product while looking to replace an old nose Frida. Had a love-hate relationship with the Frida since it’s saved us so many times and is much better than the old school bulbs, but at the same time its still tough and awkward to use. I’m glad i decided to give this one a shot because it’s soo much easier to use! We get more snot out, don’t lose our breath as quickly, snot collects in a jar, it’s easier to clean. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy L

customer_reviews.title: Essential Tool
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured and easily one of the best war on boogies tools to have in your arsenal. You control how much suction is needed and where to really clear whatever is stuck in there. Use in combination with one of the boogie sticks, saline spray, and a bulb, youll be able to provide some kind of relief for your little one.
customer_reviews.author: CSB001

customer_reviews.title: Great little gem
customer_reviews.text: Love this little gem and the case it came in. I read the reviews about people sucking up boogers but my trick to that was I used a small wad of cotton so it would catch but not block the suction like toilet paper or paper towels do. Soooo much better to clean and dry, love the case keeps our pets from chewing on the cord, easy to grab and go and this gets a lot more of my baby's mucus out than that blue tube one that's popular.
customer_reviews.author: michael kemble

customer_reviews.title: Fine nose-sucker
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I just can't get enough suction, but this just works about the same as a bulb syringe for me. My baby hasn't had a ton of runny congestion in there (which I've heard this is great for getting out), but it's been pretty standard for getting out the normal boogers that block the way every once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: small,easy to use,gives instant relief
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this instead of Nose Frida bec of the soft silicone tip. Bubzi is so much smaller, compact and comes in a cute bear shaped clear container. It's so easy to use! Just make sure to put a piece of TP or kleenex at the bottom to prevent swallowing any snots. I used this after spraying Boogie Mist and it gave my baby instant relief! This will make a perfect baby shower/registry gift!
customer_reviews.author: Z1Z2

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful product !
customer_reviews.text: This little sucker has been soooo helpful. I use a little nasal spray then go in with this and takes me only a few seconds to clear his nose out. The baby doesnt seem to mind it and I like it because the tubing is a good length so both my hands aren't all up in his face. But definitely suck hardish, the booges wont always come right out on the first suck ..depending how far back they are.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Stead

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nose Frida!
customer_reviews.text: 1. If you “eat snot” that is because you don’t pay attention & you let it get full. Gross. All you need to do it clean it out. Problem solved. This is second time purchasing it because I lost the first one while out and about with the baby. The price is great! No need to keep purchasing additional items to keep the boogers from going into the tube like the expensive nose frida. The silicone tip is gentle on the baby’s nose compare to the hard plastic of the nose frida. This is important because babies more around. They don’t enjoy having booger’s sucked out of their nose so the silicone is preferable.
customer_reviews.author: Chevie

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: not as describes useless not sucking anything the pack is beautiful and it has its own box for storing when not used but as far as practicality is exactly as below described: Was never able to remove a thing from baby nose; It is like sucking empty air and it s sad because based on good reviews I have chosen this particular one -i have 4-5 at home which do not work so I was really hoping for this one. I am increasing my rating to 3 stars just because the seller responded to my feedback promptly looking for a solution
customer_reviews.author: GINA

customer_reviews.title: Best nasal aspirator!!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting so frustrated using a bulb syringe to clean my baby’s nose. I heard of other products to use but came across this one and gave it try. One of the best purchases!! It self explanatory to use. I definitely recommend always added the tissue to the bottom container before using. The handy case is an awesome addition. Keeps everything sterile.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a game changer! I’ve used it once for my 2 month old who has a cold currently, and it seriously works SO WELL!! Its so much easier and efficient than the blue bulb. I will recommend this to every family with a baby that I know! I also love the price, and the fact that you don’t need disposable parts! I would give this 1,000 stars if I could. If only I had known about this when my oldest was a baby. Seriously. Get. One. Of. These!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: This is the nose sucker you want
customer_reviews.text: My kids have allergies and I have had all types nose suckers and this one has the best design. The fredia one is a stupid stick design and becomes a hazard when baby starts fighting back and the filter restricts suction. I had a blue blue one and the tips nose kept falling off. The Neil Med one also has a filter. Hands down best one on the market.
customer_reviews.author: HoopEarings

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nose Frieda
customer_reviews.text: I just tried this out today and I love it! The tip is nice and soft and shaped perfectly for baby or toddler nose, the area wear this snot goes holds without leaking, simple cleaning just take apart and run under hot water and soap. UPDATE: Notnsure what I'm doing wrong but now everytime I try to use this I end up with a mouth full of snot. I guess that's one benefit of nose frieda filters
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars +
customer_reviews.text: This item worked so well for my daughter that I actually came back and purchased a second one to keep in the diaper bag. Not only does it actually do the job it is made for, but it doesn't bother her in the least while doing it. I love that I don't have to pay big bucks for overpriced filters that some similar products require. If I could gove more than 5 stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: Mari A.

customer_reviews.title: You will suck up a big load of mucous
customer_reviews.text: Ya know those bulbs you're given to help remove mucous? Well this works 10x better than those. You provide the suction by sucking on the hose. A bit of tissue, that you supply, keeps the goop from shooting into your mouth. I have vacuumed my 7month old boy's sinus well to allow him to breath easily. I also irrigate with an infants' nose spray and then wait a short time for loosening to occur. Then it becomes even easier to remove with this super awesome gizmo.
customer_reviews.author: Mike O.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the nasal bulb
customer_reviews.text: My little one had some mucus in his nose that I could hear but was unsuccessful getting out with the nasal bulb. I was getting frustrated with the many tries attempted with the bulb. I stumbled on this nasal aspirator and read the reviews and decided to give it a try. I'm so glad I did, this thing works great!
customer_reviews.author: GenC

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So it's a little weird to get used to the idea of sucking out snot. It doesn't go anywhere near your mouth but it's kinda gross until you get your head around it. But it works great. My kids like it way better than the bulb kind. I had a friend borrow mine and she liked it better than a much more expensive version she had at home.
customer_reviews.author: High-Klass

customer_reviews.title: It's frustrating when your baby is still too young for medicine and they have a bad cold. He couldn't breath and the doctor recommended ...
customer_reviews.text: This is now in daily use. It's frustrating when your baby is still too young for medicine and they have a bad cold. He couldn't breath and the doctor recommended a humidifier (which we purchased) but that wasn't clearing his nose. I tried a couple of other products and nothing worked. This came up in my "recommendations" and I purchased it and put it to use the second it arrived. It's the only thing that allowed him breath through his nose and get some relief. He was able to breath and sleep. I love it! Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Spinster

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. My 4 month old doesn’t cry one bit when using it (unlike the bulb nasal aspirators). Instead she gets this funny look on her face as if she is saying “mom what are you doing?” Which is fine with me because she’s not crying! Only reason i docked 1 star is because the case broke when I just had in her diaper bag. Now I have to put it in a plastic sandwich bag, which I hate, becaue the case was so cute and kept it organized. Wish I could just order a new case but overall the product is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: This product looked promising and was super easy to clean and assemble/ disassemble, but it just did not work for us. Baby had dry boogers and this didn't do a thing. Even put a little booger flake at the tip (that I had managed to get with my finger) and this still wouldn't even get it. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Nice produce!
customer_reviews.text: So we bought this because our infant was really sick and couldn't breath. It works if you know how to use it and have help holding the babies head. I would suggest closing one nostril and opening the babies mouth before trying to such boogers/snot out. We've tried other electric booger suckers and they do suck(sucked up all the money I spent on them Becuase they suck lol.)
customer_reviews.author: Icedrake

customer_reviews.title: Better than Snot Sucker
customer_reviews.text: This is way better than the Nose Freda!!!!!!!! I have been using hat one for years and didn’t know this one existed! I ordered this bc a couple of days ago I gave my son a cut on his nose with the nose freda from the plastic tip and he kept moving bc he hates it. I just switched to this and it’s so much easier to use plus it’s so soft! I’m hooked!
customer_reviews.author: Glam Mom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I'm sad to say that I've been unable to remove anything from my daughter's nose with this :( I've tried sooooooo many times over the past 5 months since she was a newborn. So disappinted. I tried another brand that works great. This one didn't work for me. It's very easy to take apart and clean, however!!
customer_reviews.author: Mag

customer_reviews.title: Works but mucus gets into your mouth and I’ve gotten sick from swollowing his mucus.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product when my son was a newborn. He is 9 months now and have used it many times. It’s great at getting the mucus out when he lets us BUT the mucus gets to the mouthpiece and into my mouth and as a result I have caught the cold he’s had multiple times. I recommend looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great, absolutely worth a purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Really helped my newborn daughter with her congestion. I use saline drops first to lose the mucus, then I suck the mucus out of the same nostril I apply the saline to. The top is softer than other I have tried and the product is easy to wash with soap and water. I highly recommend this to help you child breathe better, feed better and keep that oxygen flowing. Remember, babies cannot breathe from their mouth for many months. Honestly worth having even before needing, every parent should own one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Better than battery operated ones
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my 6 month old. Easy to suck out the snots. The silicone tip is soft. Better than the battery operated ones, or manual pump. Easy to clean too, though i suspect i would need a small (like Dr Brown?) brush to fully clean the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Wheatie

customer_reviews.title: Artifically high rating
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, does as directed but you have to put a tissue in the canister so that you don't sick the snot in your mouth. I was upset when I received it because the bottom had a sticker offering a coupon for a 5 star rating. I think that's shady. I bought these because if the high rating but it's a farce. They work well enough but I feel a little duped.
customer_reviews.author: Gary & Sarah

customer_reviews.title: This thing works WAY better than the electric one that I use
customer_reviews.text: This thing works WAY better than the electric one that I use. I''ve never had any issues with getting snot in my mouth or it being hard to clean. I wish the "cord" was a bit longer so I didn't have to be so close to my baby's face when I'm doing it. She's probably thinking "what's this weird guy over here doing?" LOL! Other than that though, I think it's a great product. Well made, easy to clean, and gets the job done. My baby was so congested before we started using this aspirator. Definitely would reccommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! Easy to use & easy to clean! The soft tip causes less damage/bleeding with our little one, he tends to jerk his head when cleaning his nose (but that has stopped since using the Bubzi) . We prefer this over the nose freda or a bulb sucker. Was so pleased that I ordered a second one. I recommend this product to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: Oh my Goodness! I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are Prime members, so it came speedy quick! I used it this morning for my little two-month-old. WOW! Amazing! This thing is GREAT!!!! Worked like a charm... love the little carrier box and it was great that the instructions are perfectly visible and on the packaging... I hate those little instructional books that most things come with. Update: Just ordered another one for a friend who is having her baby in a few weeks! This thing is amazing! I think every mom should have one... My guess is that it will work for my older kids who still cant master the whole blowing-your-nose-into-a-tissue thing. (lol) Yeah. Definately going to be my "go to" for baby showers. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love bubzi snot sucker
customer_reviews.text: Never used a frida, so I can't compare to that. However, after using countless bulb style extractors I can say this is by far the best device! I place a bit of tissue in canister just in case. My 3 year old was intrigued by it.. the sensation is funny but the tip is soft and he even asked if he could suck out his own boogies haha. I'm due in September and look forward to using it whenever needed! Oh- and it's very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JNL424

customer_reviews.title: It Works...But Baby Still Hates It
customer_reviews.text: Giving it 5 stars because it works. If I can get my daughter held down well enough, I can suck a ton of snot out. The problem is getting her to stay still and hiding it from her until it's go-time. Be sure to put in some TP or tissue down in the bottom of the 'catcher.' So many people say they've gotten a mouthful, but I've never had an issue. I've used the product, when necessary, for nearly a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well once I get it in baby's nostril! He hates it, but who wouldn't? Easy to clean, easy to assemble. I like that the tip is flexible. I found it easiest to use it when my baby is in his high chair, and I tilt it back and come from behind. I use one arm to hold his hands down, and the other basically has him in a gentle headlock. Then I'm by the sink and I'm able to clean it right away. So thankful for this product! Has helped relieve nasal congestion for baby's first cold. I've used it as well as saline spray about 3 times a day for a week. Cold is finally clearing up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Bad Suction it will come up
customer_reviews.text: i read the reviews here and i was soo excited to get this for my newborn. The mucus comes right back on the tube which eventually could end up in your mouth the part are loose so it doesyreally suction anything. Very very disappointed i have nose frida and it doesn’t do that at all. I wasted $15 dollars on it
customer_reviews.author: S. E

customer_reviews.title: So helpful
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter has bad allergies and she is only 10 months old. She hates this so much but afterwards she is so much happier. We have to hold her still to do it but its so simple and quick. I was grossed out at first but I've used it about a dozen times now and haven't gotten any snot in my mouth so we are good!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want a respiratory infection.
customer_reviews.text: Great if you want a respiratory infection. Without a filter you end up inhaling gunk. Even the filtered ones, they're not small enough to trap viruses and bacteria. But with this one you end up inhaling noticeable fluid. So if you want to hop in the solidarity train and get sick with your baby, consider this your first class ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: It works like it is suppose to
customer_reviews.text: It works like it is suppose to. My only complaint and why I don’t actually use it, is I have a nosefrida and I can see the clear part of the nose Frida and see what’s coming out of my bsby’s Nose, with this device it’s a white tip and you can’t actually see what you are getting out of the nose until you open it to clean it. Other than, I mean it does work as advertise, and comes in a nice travel case. I just prefer the nosefrida.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Billington

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this product. I wished I would have found this product before I bought the Nose Frida. My husband hated the Frida; he was out of breath before being able to pull out the boogies from my newborn's nose. It usually took 7 or 8 tries before my husband would be able to get some of the boogies out. Usually by that point my newborn was balling her eyes out. After ordering this, my husband used it the same day it arrived. He loved it so much he told me, "Make sure you leave a review with 5 stars!" Two or three tries and boogies were out.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! Never liked the bulb suctions, though the one I got from the hospital worled great, they harbor bacteria and can be difficult to use on a wiggly baby. Nose Frida works very well but it so hard on baby's nose. This baby nasal aspirator works wonderfully, has a soft tip which is gentle on baby, and i love that i can use it while baby is sitting as gravity helps things along! My baby ( 6 months) hardly puts up any fuss!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Bushey

customer_reviews.title: Clears up runny noses quick
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me by my sister after the hospital nasal bulb wasn't cutting it. I have one that you suck but my kids would scream like crazy and it was so hard to suck. Imagine sucking ice cream out of a straw. This nose sucker actually goes inside the nose and sucks really well. I filled this thing up super quick and my baby could actually breath after wards. I couldn't believe how much was in there. He had this runny nose for a month and finally it cleared up shortly after getting this. I think clearing all the mucus helped him finally kick this cold.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Estorino

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this aspirations
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this aspirations. I bought it to replace my name brand aspirator, which didn't seem to work very well either. However, I As much as I tried, I could never really get much suction using this and, when I did get anything out of my babies nose, it was hard to see what I had gotten out because the cap is white and the snot blends right in with the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: It's great clearing her nose but its disgusting that there have ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased in 2015 to use with my son. It seemed to work well the few times we needed it. Fast forward to now, my 3 week old has been very congested so I'm using this more. It's great clearing her nose but its disgusting that there have been multiple times that that snot had come up the tube and into my mouth. I then have to disassemble, clean, dry, then start the suctioning process again. Guess I'll give the Nose Frida a shot this go round.
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as expected
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work as well as I thought it would. When socked liquid comes up through the hose. Customer service is useless. Told to return USED product to Amazon. I marked it was used all over so no one else gets it when returned.
customer_reviews.author: JEANINE KUNA

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This item is a must have!! The suction power if powerful but gentle at the same. It works like a charm and really clears out snot.
customer_reviews.author: T♡ S

customer_reviews.title: Good price but did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for boogies as advised by a friend. Even with saline, baby’s booger’s do not come out with this product. It does help sometimes to move them closer so I can get them out with a q-tip. My son has had sticky booger’s thus far, have not used this product with runny mucus. I’m going to invest in a hand held one that works on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika Estrada

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, we like the fact that you can adjust the suction by how hard you draw. Never had a problem with suck through, we put a piece of tissue in there. Super easy to clean. Awesome product for the little ones and yourself.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: I had used another brand for a long time and ...
customer_reviews.text: I had used another brand for a long time and decided to try this one. It does its job in sucking out the boogies and snots. This have a softer front and can reach inside the noses vs the competitor one was limited to the edge of the nose.
customer_reviews.author: RealDeal

customer_reviews.title: While my son still doesn’t like when I stick the Buzbi in his nose
customer_reviews.text: I have a chronically congested baby. When we first started having nose problems with him, we would have to sit in the steamy bathroom forever to loosen the snot enough for those awful bulb syringes to pull it out. Then I found the Buzbi, and thank goodness I did. While my son still doesn’t like when I stick the Buzbi in his nose, it takes a fraction of the time to get all that gunk out. I highly recommend this product to any parent who ever has to clear a child’s nose!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great concept!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for parents of a newborn and they give it a FIVE STAR ratting. It's easy to use and comfortable for the baby, unlike using the bulb syringe method that scares the baby and is uncomfortable. Thanks for a great solution to an age-old problem.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha Christie

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This product is a life-saver. Our baby is two months old and we tried to use the aspirator that looks like a pump but it did not work well. This product works great! We have used it to remove mucus every two days or so as our baby had a cold and it is really easy to use. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie B.

customer_reviews.title: Better Than NoseFrida
customer_reviews.text: It's simple, gentle, and works exactly as describe. Used this on our newborn and sucked all the boogers right out. I like it as it's not as aggressive as the traditional nasal aspirators. Update: I recently purchased a NoseFrida aspirator after I lost this one, and was very disappointed. The NoseFrida is device was larger and so was the hole, so it lacked suction and felt like I was stretching my son's nosteral. I immediately purchased another of these by Bubzi Co. On a bright note, I was able to use the foam filters from the NoseFrida on this device and it kept all the boogers in the tip for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Vince T

customer_reviews.title: Best booger sucker a mama could ask for!
customer_reviews.text: I was a proud owner of the “big name brand” nose sucker. With 3 babies under 3 years old I am a professional booger remover! I couldn’t be happier with this purchase, it works amazing. The rubber tip is much more gentle on their nose and because the tube is shorter then my old one I’m not completely out of breath after a few sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Louie Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw these things I thought... eww that's gross!!! Now, I'm glad I got this! Super easy to use, my baby loves it better then the bulb. She actually thinks it's funny. Some people say they can smell or taste the boogets... I didn't! I highly recommend. It's perfect too because it has it's own little case
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Everything rises off with hot water. :)
customer_reviews.text: I used to use the hospital sucker to get his boogies, which was not effective at all and only effective on pissing off my baby. This is gentle but gets it all out of his nose. I should have gotten this sooner. He doesn’t cry when I use it at all unlike the bulby. I love love love it. Now my baby boy can breathe.
customer_reviews.author: alissa

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I no longer have to struggle to get them boogers out little by little with the hospital suction or the smaller ones. My baby would cry as I tried and tried. With this aspirator I get so much out that I wouldn't be able to get with the other ones. I really recommend this to all the mommies.
customer_reviews.author: Ester

customer_reviews.title: This is a miracle!
customer_reviews.text: My baby has colds and cough for days now. I bought most of the medicines and oils on the market. I've been thinking twice of buying this product because I think it's complicated to use. Finally, I convinced myself to buy it. It's easy to use and in seconds, no more stuffy nose for my baby. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to Nose Freida
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Never going back to the Nose Frida. Feels less cheap than the Frida and the nostril part fits in my son's nose so much better. It allowed us to get what we usually can't with the freida and probably was more comfortable for my son. No filters... thank God. Easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have the nose frida as well, but this was recommended when my baby’s nose was all congested and I really like the design of this one. I love that the tip is soft instead of hard plastic and it is also much easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product really works so much better than the bulb aspirator I received from the hospital. Kiddo isn't really a fan but I don't believe it's hurting him. I think it's just weird for him and his default reaction is wailing like the world is ending. I just wish it can with a filter out was filter compatible. You won't suck up snot with this thing, but you're probably going to get sick with whatever your kid has that's making him snotty.
customer_reviews.author: MAC in WA

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This nasal aspirator is amazing. I opted for this rather than the nose frida because this doesn't use disposable filters, and it's way cheaper. I also really like that this has a case. The aspirator that we had from the hospital was making my baby's nose bleed. This is great because you have control over the force of the suction. The seller recommends that you insert a piece of tissue in the chamber if your child's nose is especially runny. The only time I had anything come through the tubing was when the tubing was still wet after washing it.
customer_reviews.author: E Dox

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I will never use another suction bulb. This is by far the easiest nasal aspirator i have ever used. And my baby didnt cry for one. He actually thought it was quite funny... Love this. My new baby shower gift to all my new mom friends
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Burt

customer_reviews.title: ineffective and inconvenient...
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste. I simply can not explain all he good reviews. Difficult to use with a 1-year old toddler. The line is too short and the "suction" effort you need to apply is too great to make this effective. We are going back to the regular manual rubber suction bulb.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jacobi

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for newborn parents!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my newborn baby, she was 3weeks at the time I used it. It really worked great and it didn't upset her at all. No matter how hard I found myself sucking on the parent end of the tube it didn't seem to bother her. Cleaning the device was easy, you just pop off the rubber nozzle that inserted in the babies nose and rinse it out. In the long run this will save a lot of money in comparison to other brands nose aspirators due to not having to purchase replacement filters
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to gross people out!
customer_reviews.text: It functions so we'll! I clean the part that goes in my baby's nose with a q-tip. Sometimes my baby is ok with it and sometimes he doesn't like it but it always gets his snot out and that's what counts. As a bonus every time I use it people make hilarious faces and think I'm gonna get baby boogers in my mouth!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: The BEST snot sucker!
customer_reviews.text: I was using the nose frieda and eventually had to take the hose off because the suction was so weak. I found this one and now I dont have to worry about boogers getting into my mouth! The tip fits better into my 3 month old daughters nose too! 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CuzYoung is grateful for the experience

customer_reviews.title: clean lil nose
customer_reviews.text: was using the typical suctions that the hospital give you for free. but that doesnt work well on dried snots. this works better and dont have to buy or use filters. you can also control the suction power since you are sucking it via the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Jay-r

customer_reviews.title: Challenging to get the boogers out.
customer_reviews.text: You have to suck forever to get the boogers to come to the front of the nose. Once they do you have to suck then pull it away and try to grab the booger. I sit there for ever trying to suck the booger out and grab it. Not very successful in my mission. It takes lots or patients for you and your baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just get it!
customer_reviews.text: Love love this product!! I've tried so many nasal aspirators, with no success. I even got the nose Frieda but it's too wide at the nose piece. This is genius! It fits perfectly at my child's nasal cavity, the material is soft plastic and malleable. The tubing is not too long so it works very quick and efficiently. My son doesn't fuss much with this one. I highly recommend this for every new mom!!
customer_reviews.author: Yane

customer_reviews.title: for my 1 year old Granddaughter as a replacement for one by NoseFrida that their dog chewed and I just love it. I originally pla
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Nasal Aspirator - Softest Tip by Bubzi Co. for my 1 year old Granddaughter as a replacement for one by NoseFrida that their dog chewed and I just love it. I originally planned on re-purchasing the NoseFrida which was ok until I read the reviews of the Bubzi Nasal Aspirator. I babysit my grandchildren 5 days a week and I not only love it; but my Granddaughter actually allows me to use it on her as she giggles after each suction. It is easy to use and the tip is so soft and gentle. I highly recommend this product to anyone who has children.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Essential item for toddlers with running nose
customer_reviews.text: We use it at least twice a day, once in the morning and once before bedtime. My 1-yr old fights it all the time but it works great and gets the job done. We use the saline water and put a small piece of tissue in the cup as others suggested. works great and no complaint so far. easy to clean with a q-tip.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Seriously!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical at first, but after reading several reviews on this one and a similar one from another company, I decided to give it a try. First, I like how easily it disassembles for easy cleaning. I also like the fact that it actually works and keeps the baby nasal drainage flowing into the container and not into my mouth. Baby who is 22 months, isn't terrified of it as he thinks it's kind of funny (I showed him how it works before placing it against his nostril). I'm not able to comment of the product's durability as we have only had the aspirator for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: The nose sucker that actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I love bubzi nose aspirator. We went through at least 4 other brands (nose Frida is useless) before we were recommended this one by a friend. It gets all the boogys, it is gentle on the wee one and easy to clean. I've NEVER sucked up boogys with it. As a newborn we used it daily, My son is almost 2 and I use it now for when he has colds. Look no further, don't waste your money like we did, bubzi is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: julian fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite so far!
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I’ve tried most baby nose suction devices. The Frieda didn’t give me enough suction, the munchkin worked great, but I would get a loose boogers in my mouth now and then. My kids have been plagued with snotty noses. Currently using it with a very snotty sick 9 month old. She doesn’t mind it either because of the size and nozzle soft material.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: Works!!
customer_reviews.text: With two little boys prone to colds a baby nose sucker was important but they hated the hospital ones. My Bubzi one is great! Super easy to clean and I love that I get to control the suction. Not to mention it came with an adorable case! I totally recommend it. Perfect for our new baby. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product, I have had no issues. I did see some complaints in the reviews when I was buying this product but if it is used as per instructions then there is no chance of snot reaching the sucking pipe. I love the fact that I do have to keep buying the filters like for some other products! For the price, it's worth a try!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product works well to remove baby's nasal mucus. My baby does not like it, but it does do its job. The only issue is that the mucus rarely makes it to the filter. Mucus tends to get stuck in the rubber part that enters baby nose, and it is easy to miss if you are not staring down the tiny hole of that part. That part needs to be flushed frequently and thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: Pete's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: We just received ours and it works great! To all of you saying your getting snot in your mouth or tube. I recommend reading the directions on the package. It tells you very simply what to do to create a barrier if your child is really congested or has a super runny nose. No purchase of filters needed!
customer_reviews.author: MamaMelD

customer_reviews.title: Good suction but snot in the mouth
customer_reviews.text: This has awesome suction and is much easier to clean than the nose Freida, BUT, the way the contraption works gets snot in my mouth. It is very disgusting and I almost threw up.
customer_reviews.author: Sexi_ginger

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: If your infant has any nose buggers or breathing issues, this will save your life!!! A plugged nose in an infant can equal no sleep for anyone in your house. This is easy to use and easy to clean. Tip is small enough to fit in a teeny tiny infant nostril.
customer_reviews.author: Jairus

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: my son is 14 months old and I have been using nosefrida. Since he started going to the daycare, he fights cold most of the time and I was getting tired of fighting with my son to use it on him (also to buy the hygiene filters). So I decided to give this a try and my god! It is so easy to use, so effective and so quick! So the duration of the fight got much shorter. Also no more filters.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different kinds of nasal aspirators with my kids. Wanted to try those that come with filters, but in general I'm against buying a product that "increases" the cost down the road due to buying "extra" needed pieces in order to keep using it. I love that this product is gentle in my baby's nose, that I can easily use a piece of tissue as a barrier (no extra cost added!) and the price is unbeatable compared to those expensive ones out there. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Great product concept!
customer_reviews.text: I just used the product for the first time and I'm happy that it worked. I have a seven month old that goes into a fit of rage whenever I put anything near her face,so you can imagine my surprise when she actually sit still for me to clear her nasal passages. The nasal tip is very soft and gentle on baby's nose. My only complaint would be for a larger bottom cavity to hold more mucus.Also some people may think that it's gross,but as long as you put your mind on helping your baby breathe better you will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: One of my best buys for infant
customer_reviews.text: This thing is like a miracle worker. It did its job without causing a big fuss from my newborn. No boogers went in my mouth. (This was huge fear) it relieved my infants congestion. I would definitely recommend to all parents. Soft tip for nose insertion and easy use. Great product and worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Dismukes

customer_reviews.title: Better than a traditional sucker
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for my 4 month old, he’s had congestion for about a week as soon as I got this I used it and it’s amazing I admit I wasn’t very good at using the old snot sucker and he HATED IT but with this he actually lets me suck his nose out! Great product easy to clean, great little case too overall I love the bubzi co nasal aspiration.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki brown
